required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Axis Length and Its Relationship With Refractive Error in Chinese University Students
clinical_study.official_title: Shanghai Guanghua Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine Hospital, Guanghua Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine, Shanghai, China
clinical_study.source: Shanghai Guanghua Hospital of Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the relationship between axis length (AL) and refractive error. eyes of low hyperopia to emmetropia subjects, comprising eyes with moderate to high myopia (-11.00D ≤ SE ≤ -4.00D) were analyzed in this cross-sectional study. Cycloplegic refractive error was measured with the autorefractor, AL was measured with the IOL master. Association between AL and refractive error were evaluated by linear regression analysis. The mean of AL and its correlation with SE, sex, and age were evaluated.

detailed_description.textblock: To investigate the relationship between axis length (AL) and refractive error (RE). 894 eyes with low hyperopia to emmetropia (-0.50D ≤ spherical equivalent (SE) ≤ +2.00D), comprising 1007 eyes with moderate to high myopia (-11.00D ≤ SE ≤ -4.00D) were analyzed in this study. Cycloplegic RE was measured with the autorefractor, AL was measured with the IOL master. Association between AL and refractive error were evaluated by linear regression analysis. The mean of AL and its correlation with SE, sex, and age were evaluated.

primary_outcome.description: Axis length change from baseline at 6 months
Refractive Error change from baseline at 6 months

arm_group.description: 1007 healthy students with moderate to high myopia (SE ≤ -4.00D) and 894 without myopia (-0.50D ≤ spherical power ≤ +2.00D) were enrolled.

intervention.description: visual acuity, IOL master biometry, the anterior segment with slit lamp, dilated fundus examination and refraction.

study_pop.textblock: The subject recruited for the study were 1935 students

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
with moderate to high myopia (SE ≤ -4.00D) without myopia (-0.50D ≤ spherical power ≤ +2.00D) no concurrent eye disease best corrected visual acuity is 1.0
Exclusion Criteria:
significant systemic illnesses congenital myopia, media opacity uveitis glaucoma intraocular surgery refractive surgery neurologic diseases retinal disease

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Guanghua integrated traditional Chinese and Western Medicine Hospital

facility.name: Shanghai Guanghua Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine Hospital
